column4: is there a chrome ppa? im trying to join #chrome but it seems "locked".
try chromium-browser in the repos/package manager
i have chromiun installed but i was getting increased "aw snap" messages while trying to watch youtube videos and over at #chromium they told me that i should intall chrome.
really ? now why would they recommend a browser not designed for linux over one that is ...sounds like they were just trying to get rid of you.
purge chromium-browser , then reinstall , do an updat/upgrade before reinstalling
that what i thought too..i was accually kicked.ubukou: we don't maintain ubuntu's packages. they don't go through any of our qa process, and we don't receive automated crash dumps from them either.
that was the last message.
sudo apt-get remove --purge chromium-browser ??
yes
#chromium channel was really foul in helping out. it is a thumbs down for linux support.
then, sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
i ll try it out.
then sudo apt-get install chromium-browser
should i purge chromium-* to include the ffmpeg that probably runs when using youtube?
no flash runs in youtube
i use html5
at least i think i use html5 when running youtube there is not npviewer.bin in the xfce-task-manager.
that means i am not running flash right ?
no i dont think so i just chose the html5 in the youtube settings. at least i think i did, cause chromium is loaded with CPU usage when streaming videos.
flash is everywhere on the internet  , just joining the html5 doesn't mean you don't need flash
let me try some things and get back to you with the results. thanks a lot for the help
ok
